Identification.LongTitle: An Act to implement certain provisions of the budget tabled in Parliament on March 22, 2017 and other measures

Provision.Text: Her Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as follows:

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Budget Implementation Act, 2017, No. 1.

Heading.Label: PART 1
Heading.TitleText: Amendments to the Income Tax Act and to Related Legislation

Subsection.Text: [Amendment]

Text.Repealed: [Repealed before coming into force, 2018, c. 12, s. 41]

Subsection.Text: [Amendment]
[Related Provision]
[Related Provision]

Heading.Label: PART 2
Heading.TitleText: Amendments to the Excise Tax Act (GST/HST Measures)

Heading.Label: PART 3
Heading.TitleText: Amendments to the Excise Act, the Excise Act, 2001 and the Economic Action Plan 2014 Act, No. 1

Subsection.Label: (1) and (2)
Subsection.Text: [Amendments]

Text.Repealed: [Repealed before coming into force, 2018, c. 12, s. 66]

Subsection.Text: [Related Provision]

Section.Text: Sections 68, 69, 74, 75 and 84 to 91, subsection 97(2) and sections 98 to 101 come into force on the day fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 68, 69, 74, 75 and 84 to 91, subsection 97(2) and sections 98 to 101 in force April 26, 2018, see SI/2018-38.]

Section.Text: The Borrowing Authority Act, whose text is as follows and whose schedule is set out in Schedule 1 to this Act, is enacted:

Heading.TitleText: Amendment to the Financial Administration Act
Amendment to the Hibernia Development Project Act
Consequential Amendment to the Budget Implementation Act, 2016, No. 1

Section.Text: Section 103 comes into force on the day on which section 183 of the Budget Implementation Act, 2016, No. 1 comes into force.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 103 in force November 23, 2017, see SI/2017-73.]

Subsection.Text: Section 110 comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 110 in force May 10, 2019, see SI/2019-26.]

Subsection.Text: Section 111 comes into force on the day on which section 160 of the Budget Implementation Act, 2016, No. 1 comes into force or, if it is later, on the day on which this Act receives royal assent.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 111 in force March 26, 2018, see SI/2018-28.]

Heading.Label: DIVISION 5
Heading.TitleText: Payment to the Canadian Institute for Advanced Research

Section.Text: There may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund, on the requisition of the Minister of Industry, a sum not exceeding $125,000,000 to the Canadian Institute for Advanced Research to support a pan-Canadian artificial intelligence strategy.

Subsection.Text: Section 116 comes into force on August 1, 2018.
Sections 117 to 120 come into force on January 1, 2018.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 7
Heading.TitleText: Parliamentary Budget Officer and Board of Internal Economy

TitleText.XRefExternal: Garnishment, Attachment and Pension Diversion Act
Parliamentary Employment and Staff Relations Act

Section.Text: Sections 126 to 129 and 131 to 190 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 126 to 129 and 131 to 190 in force September 21, 2017, see SI/2017-53.]

Heading.Label: DIVISION 9
Heading.TitleText: Funding for Home Care Services and Mental Health Services

Subsection.Text: For the fiscal year beginning on April 1, 2017, the Minister of Finance must pay to a province the amounts determined in accordance with subsections (2) and (3) for the purposes of assisting the province to provide home care services and mental health services if, no later than March 30, 2018, the Minister of Health notifies the Minister of Finance in writing that, in his or her opinion, the government of the province, before December 15, 2017, has accepted the federal proposal to strengthen health care for Canadians made on December 19, 2016.
The amount to be paid for the purposes of assisting a province to provide home care services is the amount determined in accordance with the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the population of the province, according to the official estimate of the population of the province on July 1, 2016 published by Statistics Canada on September 28, 2016; and
is the total of the population of all provinces, according to the official estimate of the population of all provinces on July 1, 2016 published by Statistics Canada on September 28, 2016.

Subsection.Text: The amount to be paid for the purposes of assisting a province to provide mental health services is the amount determined in accordance with the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the population of the province, according to the official estimate of the population of the province on July 1, 2016 published by Statistics Canada on September 28, 2016; and
is the total of the population of all provinces, according to the official estimate of the population of all provinces on July 1, 2016 published by Statistics Canada on September 28, 2016.

Subsection.Text: Any amount to be paid under this section is to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund.
Subject to subsection (2), the provisions of this Division come into force on a day or days to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 196 to 219 and 222 to 227 in force September 29, 2017, see SI/2017-60.]

Subsection.Text: Sections 220 and 221 are deemed to have come into force on April 1, 2016.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 11
Heading.TitleText: Support for Families: Benefits and Leaves

Section.Text: This Division, other than sections 257, 258 and 268, comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council, which may not be earlier than July 10, 2017.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Division 11, other than sections 257, 258 and 268, in force December 3, 2017, see SI/2017-68.]

TitleText.XRefExternal: Canadian Forces Members and Veterans Re-establishment and Compensation Act

Subsection.Text: [Amendments]

Unless the context requires otherwise, every reference to the “Canadian Forces Members and Veterans Re-establishment and Compensation Act” in any provision of an Act of Parliament other than a provision referred to in subsection (1) is to be read as a reference to the “Veterans Well-being Act”.

TitleText.XRefExternal: Jobs, Growth and Long-term Prosperity Act

Section.Text: The provisions of this Division, other than sections 290, 291 and 296, come into force on April 1, 2018.
This Division comes into force on April 1, 2018.

Text.Repealed: [Repealed before coming into force, 2018, c. 27, s. 508]

TitleText.XRefExternal: Parliamentary Employment and Staff Relations Act

Subsection.Text: Subsections 318(1), 320(1) and 322(1), section 323, subsections 324(2) and 325(1) and (2), sections 326 to 328, subsections 329(1) and (2), sections 330 to 337, subsection 338(1), sections 339 to 349 and 351 to 355, subsections 356(2) and (3), 363(8) and 364(2), section 365, subsection 368(1) and sections 370, 378 to 383, 387 and 391 to 397 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council, but that day must not be before the days fixed in accordance with subsections (2) and (6).

Footnote.Text: [Note: Subsections 318(1), 320(1) and 322(1), section 323, subsections 324(2) and 325(1) and (2), sections 326 to 328, subsections 329(1) and (2), sections 330 to 337, subsection 338(1), sections 339 to 349 and 351 to 355, subsections 356(2) and (3), 363(8) and 364(2), section 365, subsection 368(1) and sections 370, 378 to 383, 387 and 391 to 397 in force July 29, 2019, see SI/2019-76.]

Subsection.Text: Subsection 318(2), section 319, subsections 338(2) and 356(1) and section 384 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Subsection 318(2), section 319, subsections 338(2) and 356(1) and section 384 in force July 29, 2019, see SI/2019-76.]

Subsection.Text: Subsections 320(2), 322(2), 325(3) and 329(3), section 360, subsections 363(2), (5), (6) and (9) and 364(3) and sections 373, 377, 386 and 390 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council, but that day must not be before the day fixed in accordance with subsection (1).

Footnote.Text: [Note: Subsections 320(2), 322(2), 325(3) and 329(3), section 360, subsections 363(2), (5), (6) and (9) and 364(3) and sections 373, 377, 386 and 390 in force January 1, 2021, see SI/2020-74.]

Subsection.Text: Sections 350 and 376 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Sections 357 and 359, subsections 361(1), (3) and (4), section 362, subsections 363(1), (4) and (7) and 364(1) and sections 371, 374 and 385 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 359 repealed before coming into force, see 2018, c. 27, s. 508; section 357, subsections 361(1), (3) and (4), section 362, subsections 363(1), (4) and (7) and 364(1) and sections 371, 374 and 385 in force April 1, 2019, see SI/2019-4.]

Subsection.Text: Section 358, subsection 361(2) and sections 369, 372 and 375 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council, but that day must not be before the day fixed in accordance with subsection (5).

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 358, subsection 361(2) and sections 369, 372 and 375 in force April 1, 2019, see SI/2019-4.]

Subsection.Text: Subsections 363(3) and 364(4), sections 366 and 367, subsection 368(2) and sections 388 and 389 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Subsections 363(3) and 364(4), sections 366 and 367, subsection 368(2) and sections 388 and 389 in force April 1, 2019, see SI/2019-4.]

Section.Text: The Canada Infrastructure Bank Act is enacted as follows:

TitleText.XRefExternal: Payments in Lieu of Taxes Act
Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act

Heading.TitleText: Related Amendment to the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act

Subsection.Text: Subsection 408(1), subsections 415(2) and (3), section 417, subsections 423(1) and (3) and sections 425 and 438 come into force on a day to be fixed by the Governor in Council, but that day must not be earlier than the day after the day on which section 258 of the Economic Action Plan 2014 Act, No. 1 comes into force.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Subsection 408(1), subsections 415(2) and (3), section 417, subsections 423(1) and (3) and sections 425 and 438 in force June 1, 2021, see SI/2019-43.]

Subsection.Text: Section 434 comes into force on the day after the day on which section 258 of the Economic Action Plan 2014 Act, No. 1 comes into force or, if it is later, on the day on which this Act receives royal assent.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 434 in force on assent June 22, 2017.]

Section.Text: The Invest in Canada Act is enacted as follows:
The provisions of this Division comes into force on a day or days to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 442 to 449 in force March 12, 2018, see SI/2018-15.]

Section.Text: The Service Fees Act is enacted as follows:

Heading.TitleText: Related Amendment to the Economic Action Plan 2014 Act, No. 1

Subsection.Text: [Amendments]

Subsection.MarginalNote: Other references to User Fees Act
Subsection.Text: Unless the context requires otherwise, every reference to the User Fees Act in any provision of an Act of Parliament other than a provision referred to in subsection (1) is to be read as a reference to the Service Fees Act.
Sections 16 to 18 and paragraph 20(1)(g) of the Service Fees Act, as enacted by section 451 of this Act, come into force on April 1, 2018.
Section 22 of the Service Fees Act, as enacted by section 451 of this Act, comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 22 of the Service Fees Act, as enacted by section 451, in force May 1, 2019, see SI/2019-20.]
